greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number T(n,k) of partitions of n into colored blocks of equal parts, such that all colors from a set of size k are used and the colors are introduced in increasing order; triangle T(n,k), n>=0, 0<=k<=A003056(n), read by rows.
comment: T(n,k) is defined for all n>=0 and k>=0.  The triangle contains only elements with 0 <= k <= A003056(n).  T(n,k) = 0 for k > A003056(n).
For fixed k>=1, T(n,k) ~ exp(sqrt(2*(Pi^2 - 6*polylog(2, 1-k))*n/3)) * sqrt(Pi^2 - 6*polylog(2, 1-k)) / (4*k!*sqrt(3*k)*Pi*n). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Sep 18 2019
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..1000, flattened
maple: b:= proc(n, i, k) option remember; `if`(n=0, 1, `if`(i<1, 0, add(
T:= (n, k)-> add(b(n$2, k-i)*(-1)^i*binomial(k, i), i=0..k)/k!:
mathematica: T[n_, k_] := Sum[b[n, n, k - i] (-1)^i Binomial[k, i], {i, 0, k}]/k!;
Table[Table[T[n, k], {k, 0, Floor[(Sqrt[1 + 8n] - 1)/2]}], {n, 0, 20}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 14 2020, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Aug 27 2019
